name: RunWorkflow
description: Starts a GitHub workflow (action), waits for completion, downloads the artifacts
author: Seva Alekseyev

inputs.name: gh
inputs.label: GitHub service connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: A GitHub type service connection to use. The token must have the rights to read and invoke actions. Github Enterprise is not supported.

inputs.name: repo
inputs.label: Owner/Repository
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The owner name and the repo name, slash separated.
If your repo is at https://github.com/acme/widgets/, then this parameter should be "acme/widgets".

inputs.name: workflow
inputs.label: Workflow name
inputs.helpMarkdown:
Name of the workflow to run, case insensitive. If blank, the first workflow in the repo will be chosen.
This parameter should match the contents of the `name:` line in your workflow's YAML file on GitHub.
IMPORTANT: the workflow file must have a `workflow_dispatch:` line under `on:`.

inputs.name: ref
inputs.label: Branch or tag
inputs.helpMarkDown: Branch or tag to run the workflow against. If omitted, "master" will be used.

inputs.name: timeout
inputs.label: Timeout, min
inputs.helpMarkDown: Waiting for the run to finish will time out and error out eventually.

inputs.name: dlArtifacts
inputs.label: Download artifacts
inputs.helpMarkDown:
If the action publishes any artifacts, they will be downloaded into subfolders (or, optionally, kept as ZIP archives) under the current folder, corresponding to artifact names. The contents of existing folders will be overwritten.
In builds, the current folder is the sources folder (Build.SourcesDirectory).

inputs.name: noUnzip
inputs.label: Do not unzip
inputs.helpMarkDown: Check this to keep the downloaded artifacts in the target folder as ZIP archives.

inputs.name: inputs
inputs.label: Workflow inputs
inputs.helpMarkDown:
A JSON object with the workflow input parameters.
Those should be defined in the workflow YAML on GitHub under `on:workflow_dispatch:inputs`.
